text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 25px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 13px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: A sequence is an ordered list of numbers. The following is a sequence of odd numbers

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 13px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 13px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: A term of a sequence is identified by its position in the sequence. In the above sequence, 1 is the first term,

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 13px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer; fill-opacity: 1;
text.tspan: Q ) In sequence S, the 3rd term is 4, the 2nd term is three times the 1st, and the 3rd term is four
times the 2nd. What is the 1st term in sequence S?

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 13px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: Ans ) Let the first three terms be a, b and c Given that c= 4 and 2nd term b is 3 times first term a

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 13px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: => b = 3a and also 3rd term c is 4 times 2nd term b = > c = 4b

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 13px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: but given c = 4 , from c = 4b , we have b = c/4 =1

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 13px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, sans-serif; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: ∴ The three terms of the sequence are 1/3 , 1 , /4
